text: Mr. President: stop your racist, hateful and anti-immigrant rhetoric. Your language creates a climate which emboldens violent extremists.

Focusing on flipping the Senate should be our #1 electoral priority right now.

Presidential candidates have all of media focused on them - they’re good rn. We need to boost Senate candidates & get organizing.

What Senate races + candidates are you looking at? Comment below ⬇️ https://twitter.com/brianschatz/status/1157773740199075842 QT @brianschatz If you are pissed off. If you are sad. If you are disgusted. If you feel guilty. If you don’t know what to do. If you want to help. PICK. A. SENATE. RACE.

RT @shannonrwatts White supremacists used guns in 70% of US domestic terror attacks and are responsible for more deaths than any domestic extremist movement.

We are the only high income country that gives white supremacists easy access to arsenals and ammo.

Dayton #WhiteSupremacistTerrorism https://twitter.com/fox5dc/status/1158056059250139142 QT @fox5dc BREAKING: U.S. attorney says the deadly El Paso shooting is being treated as domestic terrorism and Dayton, Ohio authorities identify the man who shot and killed 9 people as a 24 year old male
Another heartbreaking and senseless attack. Madness, this killing of God’s children. We mourn for the victims in Dayton and for the many who knew and loved them.

RT @RepKClark The House passed two gun safety bills months ago, but you continue to block them.

Since you tweeted your prayers, another American community, Dayton, has been shattered by gun violence.

Americans are dying, and you’re blocking us from helping them.

Who exactly do you serve? https://twitter.com/senatemajldr/status/1157787985041088513 QT @senatemajldr The entire nation is horrified by today's senseless violence in El Paso. Elaine's and my prayers go out to the victims of this terrible violence, their families and friends, and the brave first responders who charged into harm’s way.

We need to call it out: Fox News is a hate-for-profit machine that gives a megaphone to racists and conspiracists. https://twitter.com/Leahgreenb/status/1158047354852925441 QT @Leahgreenb Let's all be really clear on this:

The shooting in El Paso was a terrorist attack targeting Latinx people. It was spurred by the same white nationalist ideology that is promoted by the President of the United States and mainstreamed by Fox News.

As the son of a Cuban immigrant, I am deeply horrified by the hateful anti-Hispanic bigotry expressed in the shooter’s so-called ‘manifesto.’ This ignorant racism is repulsive and profoundly anti-American.

The House passed a bill more than 5 months ago to require basic background checks on gun sales — the very least we can do to keep our loved ones safe. How many more people need to die before @SenateMajLdr McConnell puts aside @NRA interests and gives that bill a vote?
RT @SenatorRomney The nation has witnessed senseless loss of life from recent mass shootings in El Paso, Dayton, and Gilroy. My statement: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBKtqwIWsAA7nGL.jpg

I’ll be there. Over the last day, the outpouring of support for the victims, first responders, and local authorities in El Paso has been overwhelming and heartening. In response to this despicable hate meant to divide us, the people of El Paso immediately and powerfully came together.

RT @RepLucyMcBath As we mourned the 20 lives lost after one hate-filled massacre in El Paso, more innocent Americans were murdered in Dayton.

The same hate-fueled gun violence in El Paso is what killed my son in 2012.

MLK said only love can drive out hate. We must act now to save American lives.

RT @MarielenaNILC The hatred & racism being fueled by Trump & others leads to this type of violence. Messages of #gobacktowhereyoucamefrom  embolden ##WhiteSupremacists despite “Hispanics” always living in #Texas & Southwest. We must end #GunViolence & #WhiteSupremacy 3/3

This is a moral moment in our country. While our hearts break for El Paso and Dayton, we have an obligation to act and put an end to this epidemic—now. Washington needs to stop answering to the corporate gun lobby and start answering to victims of gun violence and their families.

97% of Americans support bipartisan background checks. The House has taken action. 

As @SherrodBrown said, Mitch McConnell must act now. #GiveUsAVote 🎥 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1158077654421168128/pu/img/clXcCYIkft8r8lob.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1158077654421168128/pu/vid/480x270/1nfcKfhlUlcEfdK6.mp4?tag=10

Some may be surprised by perpetual acts of gun violence after OH & TX - but many communities aren’t.

https://chicago.cbslocal.com/2019/08/04/weekend-shootings-chicago-2/

Democrats, Republicans, Independents and even gun owners agree, ENOUGH is ENOUGH. It is time to stand up to the NRA and take action to make our communities safer from gun violence.

Mitch McConnell, call the Senate back from recess now and pass gun safety legislation.

And Marchant’s DFW-area district is highly competitive.  After winning it by double digits, he only carried it by three last year.

We have got to come together as a nation and combat the rise of violent white supremacist extremism.

That means redirecting federal resources to address this threat to our national security.

White supremacy is domestic terrorism. The President must call it out and condemn it. El Paso and our country deserve better.

I know we are full of faith in the promise of tomorrow, but I also know that to get to tomorrow, we must fight today.

Honored to spend the morning with worshipers at Victory Baptist Church in Las Vegas, who understand the importance of speaking up and speaking out against hate. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBKNMMWXkAIqCCZ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158142837394944000/vid/320x320/mTkTo85brbfwIxml.mp4?tag=13

We're waking up to the second mass shooting in as many days. I’m heartsick for the 29 people killed this weekend in El Paso and Dayton—and all the other lives we lose every day due to senseless gun violence. We need to take urgent action to end the gun violence epidemic.

We must speak clearly to combat evil in any form it takes. What we saw yesterday was a heinous act of terrorism and white supremacy. There is no place for this in El Paso, in Texas, or anywhere across our nation.
 
We are all Americans and we are all standing united with El Paso.

The two horrible attacks in Texas & Ohio should sadden & concern all Americans.

May God bless those impacted by these heartbreaking tragedies & the police,paramedics,doctors & nurses who saved lives.

According to authorities, 9 people were killed and 26 were injured in the Dayton shooting. It lasted less than a minute.

Less than a minute.

We cannot remain idle and allow this level of carnage to ravage our communities. We need courage. We need to act.

Senator McConnell, bring a bill to fight this gun violence epidemic to the Senate floor for a vote. 

These were passed by the House five months ago: 
∙ Bipartisan Background Checks Act 
∙ Enhanced Background Checks Act

Without action, your words are meaningless and insulting. https://twitter.com/senatemajldr/status/1158036816089497601 QT @senatemajldr Sickening to learn this morning of another mass murder in Dayton, Ohio overnight. Two horrifying acts of violence in less than 24 hours. We stand with law enforcement as they continue working to keep Americans safe and bring justice.

& again, this time asking the FBI.

It seems easier to label domestic, self-radicalized shooters who are Muslim as terrorists.

Yet white supremacists, who are responsible for far more violence in the US,often escape these charges.

Now they’re the #1 source of domestic terror ⬇️ https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1136304925212905474 QT @nowthisnews Rep. @AOC confronted this official about why the FBI doesn’t treat white supremacists the way it treats other terrorists http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1136269318877065219/img/fdnmlrJuZSjLP-ik.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1136269318877065219/vid/320x320/AM74w7ZezYWYOypz.mp4?tag=13

Mitch McConnell should bring the Senate back into session immediately to pass HR 8, the gun safety bill that has already passed the House. That's a first step to addressing our serious gun violence epidemic.

White supremacy & networks of white supremacists terrorrists are alive & supported by political leaders. 

This must end. Need actions, not words. #WhiteSupremacistTerrorism #ElPasoShooting

Trump has emboldened white nationalism across our country. He needs to go. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBKYPyMW4AEbGo-.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158154643903537152/vid/480x270/KuIrIWC8yX-aAxcG.mp4?tag=13

RT @GiffordsCourage There have been 216 days in 2019. 

There have been 253 mass shootings. 

Our gun violence crisis won’t get better until our leaders have the courage to reject the gun lobby and fight for our safety. 

Call your senators and demand an emergency special session: 1-877-960-2185 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBJuD-aWwAEAu1q.jpg

We need leadership in this country that is unequivocal in condemning violence and hatred.

Seeing an American president describe people marching under a swastika as “good people” fills me with anger and disgust. But that anger has to be channeled into nonviolent political action.

In March, I was asked about the increase in hate crimes since the election of Donald Trump. I want to be very clear: White supremacists pose a threat to the United States like any other terrorist group—and we need to use the full force of the Justice Department to go after them. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBJ3xQoX4AA-CoB.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158118977383608325/vid/320x320/YjTxrisN1m6mVzRN.mp4?tag=13

We need to ban the manufacture, sale and transfer of weapons of war. Period.

We have got to implement a buyback program to get these weapons off the streets.

And we have got to regulate assault weapons in the same way that we currently regulate fully automatic weapons.

We must call these mass shootings exactly what they are: domestic terrorism. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBJa8w1WsAImLFr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158087349638717440/vid/480x270/apczRtevE0nWvURP.mp4?tag=13

Make no mistake, tomorrow the @NRA will go back to doing the dirty work of gun manufacturers and blocking progress at every turn. @SenateMajLdr must call us back into session to vote on the two background check bills that have already passed the House. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBLSGLjXYAAZkCT.jpg

This is a national crisis. Mitch McConnell needs to bring the Senate back from recess right now and hold votes on legislation to protect Americans from gun violence. Enough. We need to end this carnage now.

We don't lack good ideas when it comes to gun safety reforms — people lack the courage to act. That's why, when elected president, I'm prepared to take executive action and save lives. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBJhxRNX4AMC91Q.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158094614261325825/vid/480x270/R3G09VVbS2T5kOJ8.mp4?tag=13

There are more than 5 million assault weapons out on the streets of America, which is more than the U.S. military has. That is insane. We must ban the sale, distribution and transfer of assault weapons in the United States.

RT @Blklivesmatter It very hard right now and it’s ok to feel despair in these moments. But stay strong, remember to find joy, and don’t let them break us. 

In solidarity and love to all.

We must speak clearly to combat evil in any form it takes. What we saw yesterday was a heinous act of terrorism and white supremacy. There is no place for this in El Paso, in Texas, or anywhere across our nation.

One of the lessons in my faith is that you reap what you sow. 

When Donald Trump uses words like “infestation,” “invasion” and “shithole countries”—

When he refuses to condemn Neo-Nazis and white supremacists—

Trump is giving license to this kind of violence. He’s responsible. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBIsCkRXUAAhSj1.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1158033233935818752/vid/480x270/bwtvp5hvkqhwBjcs.mp4?tag=13

These are terrorist acts of war, and we need a national response. https://medium.com/@BernieSanders/we-must-bring-people-together-not-instigate-hatred-74072b21c83b
